column4: ok i seem to be haveing a real issue    i install ubuntu and update and install my vid driver and evernthing goes haywire
do you get an error from x11 when you try to start up ubuntu after installing your nvidia drivers?
yes sorry not use to nick first

i don't know why, but all of the dx10 nvidia cards seem to do that. i don't know if yours is a dx10 card, but your error sounds like mine when i tried installing ubuntu with an 8800 gts. i used https://launchpad.net/envy/ to automate the installation and then it worked fine
although by the time i got around to using that autoinstalling script, i had already dicked around with my xorg.conf settings, so i don't know if it'll work right out of the box for you
im ready to try anything at this point i figure i should ahve had a working system eve for noob like me a week ago
yeah, i understand the feeling. btw, here's the link to the author's download page for envy http://www.albertomilone.com/nvidia_scripts1.html
canu span the apt get build essiental command in sytax i thought i had it wrote done but aparently not
sorry, i'm a bit confused. what exactly are you asking?
i think its supposed to be apt-get install build essiental  but thats wrong somehow to
did you run "sudo apt-get update" and "sudo apt-get upgrade" first?
oh yeah, what Flannel said; build-essential not build essential
what order would you run those in
update first, then upgrade then build-essential
although it sounds like your problem may just be in forgetting to use build-essential instead of build essential. but doing update/upgrade doesn't hurt anyways, so you might as well do them
i agree. but it's worth doing in the end. you learn so much, and you feel much better after having understood how things work
